1import astropy as ap 

2import astropy.coordinates as ap_coordinates 

3import astropy.table as ap_table 

4import astropy.units as ap_units 

5 

6import opihiexarata.library as library 

7import opihiexarata.library.error as error 

8import opihiexarata.library.hint as hint 

9 

10__MPC_TABLE_NAME_TYPE_PAIR = { 

11 "minor_planet_number": str, 

12 "provisional_number": str, 

13 "discovery": bool, 

14 "publishable_note": str, 

15 "observing_note": str, 

16 "year": int, 

17 "month": int, 

18 "day": float, 

19 "ra": float, 

20 "dec": float, 

21 "blank_1": str, 

22 "magnitude": float, 

23 "bandpass": str, 

24 "blank_2": str, 

25 "observatory_code": str, 

26} 

27MPC_MINOR_PLANET_TABLE_COLUMN_NAMES = list(__MPC_TABLE_NAME_TYPE_PAIR.keys()) 

28MPC_MINOR_PLANET_TABLE_COLUMN_TYPES = list(__MPC_TABLE_NAME_TYPE_PAIR.values()) 

29 

30 

31def blank_minor_planet_table() -> hint.Table: 

32 """Creates a blank table which contains the columns which are recognized by 

33 the MPC standard 80-column record format. 

34 

35 Parameters 

36 ---------- 

37 None 

38 

39 Returns 

40 ------- 

41 blank_table : Astropy Table 

42 The table with only the column headings; no records are in the table. 

43 """ 

44 # The names of the columns 

45 column_names = MPC_MINOR_PLANET_TABLE_COLUMN_NAMES 

46 data_types = MPC_MINOR_PLANET_TABLE_COLUMN_TYPES 

47 blank_table = ap_table.Table(names=column_names, dtype=data_types) 

48 return blank_table 

49 

50 

51def minor_planet_record_to_table(records: list[str]) -> hint.Table: 

52 """This converts an 80 column record for minor planets to a table 

53 representing the same data. 

54 

55 The documentation for how the columns are assigned is provided by the 

56 Minor Planet Center: 

57 https://www.minorplanetcenter.net/iau/info/OpticalObs.html 

58 

59 Parameters 

60 ---------- 

61 records : list 

62 The records in MPC format. Each entry of the list should be an 80 

63 column string representing an observed record, a single line. 

64 

65 Returns 

66 ------- 

67 table : Astropy Table 

68 A table containing the same information that is in the MPC record 

69 format in an easier interface. 

70 """ 

71 # Each line of the record should be 80 characters long. 

72 for linedex in records: 

73 if len(linedex) != 80: 

74 raise error.InputError( 

75 "At least one of the lines is not 80 characters in length. It is not a" 

76 " standard MPC 80-column format." 

77 ) 

78 # A reusable function to extract the data from the a record to a list of 

79 # parameters. 

80 def _record_to_row_dictionary(line_string: str) -> dict: 

81 """Creating a table row from the data found in a record.""" 

82 # Raw values from the record. 

83 raw_minor_planet_number = line_string[0:5] 

84 raw_provincial_designation = line_string[5:12] 

85 raw_discovery_asterisk = line_string[12] 

86 raw_publishable_note = line_string[13] 

87 raw_observing_note = line_string[14] 

88 raw_obs_date = line_string[15:32] 

89 raw_obs_ra = line_string[32:44] 

90 raw_obs_dec = line_string[44:56] 

91 raw_blank_1 = line_string[56:65] 

92 raw_mag_and_band = line_string[65:71] 

93 raw_blank_2 = line_string[71:77] 

94 raw_observatory_code = line_string[77:80] 

95 # Convert these raw extracted values into more typical and standard values 

96 # which is more prosessable. They are done as follows. 

97 # The minor planet number. 

98 minor_planet_number = raw_minor_planet_number 

99 # The provincial designation of the asteroid. 

100 provincial_designation = raw_provincial_designation 

101 # The discovery asterisk can be converted to a boolean. 

102 discovery = True if raw_discovery_asterisk == "*" else False 

103 # Publishing note flag. 

104 publishable_note = str(raw_publishable_note) 

105 # Observeing note flag. 

106 observing_note = str(raw_observing_note) 

107 # The observation date can be split. 

108 year, month, day = raw_obs_date.split() 

109 year = int(year) 

110 month = int(month) 

111 day = float(day) 

112 # Converting the RA to DEC to decimal degrees, leveraging Astropy. 

113 skycoord = ap_coordinates.SkyCoord( 

114 raw_obs_ra, 

115 raw_obs_dec, 

116 frame="icrs", 

117 unit=(ap_units.hourangle, ap_units.deg), 

118 ) 

119 ra = skycoord.ra.value 

120 dec = skycoord.dec.value 

121 # First blank reservation. This is supposed to be reserved blank space. 

122 # But, it seems some people use it for whatever. Keeping it to string. 

123 blank_1 = str(raw_blank_1) 

124 # The magnitude and the bandpass can be split. 

125 mag_str = str(raw_mag_and_band[:-1]).strip() 

126 magnitude = float(mag_str) if len(mag_str) != 0 else float("nan") 

127 bandpass = str(raw_mag_and_band[-1]) 

128 # Second blank reservation. This is supposed to be reserved blank space. 

129 # But, it seems some people use it for whatever. Keeping it to string. 

130 blank_2 = str(raw_blank_2) 

131 # Observatory code, it is not always a number and can have letters in it. 

132 observatory_code = str(raw_observatory_code) 

133 

134 # Constructing a dictionary representing the row which can then be used to 

135 # add it to the table. The entries must be in order. We use the 

136 # constant column names. 

137 ordered_entries = [ 

138 minor_planet_number, 

139 provincial_designation, 

140 discovery, 

141 publishable_note, 

142 observing_note, 

143 year, 

144 month, 

145 day, 

146 ra, 

147 dec, 

148 blank_1, 

149 magnitude, 

150 bandpass, 

151 blank_2, 

152 observatory_code, 

153 ] 

154 record_dict = dict(zip(MPC_MINOR_PLANET_TABLE_COLUMN_NAMES, ordered_entries)) 

155 return record_dict 

156 

157 # It is easier to make the Table from a list of rows representative 

158 # objects. 

159 table_rows_list = [] 

160 # Going through each of the rows to extract the information into their 

161 # string representations. 

162 for linedex in records: 

163 # Extract the information 

164 try: 

165 temp_record_dict = _record_to_row_dictionary(line_string=linedex) 

166 except Exception: 

167 # For some reason, some of the lines in an 80-column MPC entry do 

168 # not seem to obey the format as understood by Sparrow. 

169 # TODO. 

170 continue 

171 # Add it to the records. 

172 table_rows_list.append(temp_record_dict) 

173 

174 # Construct the Astropy Table. If nothing was provided, still provide a 

175 # blank table as there are still keyword expectations. 

176 table = ap_table.Table(rows=table_rows_list) 

177 table = table if len(table) != 0 else blank_minor_planet_table() 

178 return table 

179 

180 

181def minor_planet_table_to_record(table: hint.Table) -> list[str]: 

182 """This converts an 80 column record for minor planets to a table 

183 representing the same data. 

184 

185 This function provides a minimal amount of verification that the input 

186 table is correct. If the provided entry of the table is too long, the text 

187 is striped of whitespace and then ususally cut. 

188 

189 The documentation for how the columns are assigned is provided by the 

190 Minor Planet Center: 

191 https://www.minorplanetcenter.net/iau/info/OpticalObs.html 

192 

193 Parameters 

194 ---------- 

195 table : Astropy Table 

196 A table containing the same information that can be written as the 

197 standard 80-column record. 

198 

199 Returns 

200 ------- 

201 records : list 

202 The records in MPC format. Each entry is 80 characters long and are in 

203 the standard format. The entries are derived from the provided table 

204 with information cut to fit into the format. 

205 """ 

206 # Check that the table has the required column headers. Although the order 

207 # is not required to be the same, ensuring the same order ensures the 

208 # blank table was used as a template. 

209 column_names = MPC_MINOR_PLANET_TABLE_COLUMN_NAMES 

210 if table.colnames != column_names: 

211 raise error.InputError( 

212 "The headers of the table do not match the expected column names. This" 

213 " function only can handle tables with the expected names." 

214 ) 

215 # An inner function to convert a table row to a record 80-col string. 

216 # It is easier to understand this way despite the performance hit. 

217 def _record_to_row_string(row: hint.Row) -> str: 

218 # Every thing needs to be a string. This is a wrapper function which 

219 # helps with the spacing and column widths. 

220 def _construct_string(entry: str, exact_length: int, justify: str) -> str: 

221 """A unified function to create a string for the entry provided. 

222 This function handles justification and string clipping for too 

223 long strings. Provided the entry, the maximum length allowed by 

224 the 80-column specification, and how the string ought to be 

225 justified. 

226 """ 

227 entry_str = str(entry)[:exact_length] 

228 # Determine justification. 

229 justify = justify.casefold() 

230 if justify == "left": 

231 justified_entry_str = entry_str.ljust(exact_length, " ") 

232 elif justify == "right": 

233 justified_entry_str = entry_str.rjust(exact_length, " ") 

234 else: 

235 raise error.DevelopmentError( 

236 "The justification option provided is not supported." 

237 ) 

238 # All done. 

239 assert len(justified_entry_str) == exact_length 

240 return justified_entry_str 

241 

242 # Obtain each of the parameters and employ the needed constraints upon 

243 # them so that they match the 80-column standard format. 

244 # The minor planet number. 

245 raw_minor_planet_number = str(row["minor_planet_number"]) 

246 str_minor_planet_number = _construct_string( 

247 entry=raw_minor_planet_number, exact_length=5, justify="left" 

248 ) 

249 # The provisional designation. 

250 raw_provisional_number = str(row["provisional_number"]) 

251 str_provisional_number = _construct_string( 

252 entry=raw_provisional_number, exact_length=7, justify="left" 

253 ) 

254 # The discovery asterisk flag. 

255 raw_discovery = bool(row["discovery"]) 

256 str_discovery = "*" if raw_discovery else " " 

257 # The publishing note. 

258 raw_publishable_note = str(row["publishable_note"]) 

259 str_publishable_note = _construct_string( 

260 entry=raw_publishable_note, exact_length=1, justify="right" 

261 ) 

262 # The observational note. 

263 raw_observing_note = str(row["observing_note"]) 

264 str_observing_note = _construct_string( 

265 entry=raw_observing_note, exact_length=1, justify="right" 

266 ) 

267 # The date of observation. The month and days need leading zeros if 

268 # it is not a double digit date. 

269 raw_year = str(row["year"]) 

270 raw_month = "0" + str(row["month"]) if row["month"] < 10 else str(row["month"]) 

271 raw_day = "0" + str(row["day"]) if row["day"] < 10 else str(row["day"]) 

272 raw_observing_date = " ".join([raw_year, raw_month, raw_day]) 

273 str_observing_date = _construct_string( 

274 entry=raw_observing_date, exact_length=17, justify="left" 

275 ) 

276 # The right ascension and declination. 

277 skycoord = ap_coordinates.SkyCoord( 

278 float(row["ra"]), float(row["dec"]), frame="icrs", unit="deg" 

279 ) 

280 raw_str_ra = skycoord.ra.to_string( 

281 ap_units.hour, sep=":", pad=True, precision=None 

282 ) 

283 raw_str_dec = skycoord.dec.to_string( 

284 ap_units.deg, sep=":", pad=True, precision=None, alwayssign=True 

285 ) 

286 # MPC record uses spaces as seperator. 

287 raw_str_ra = raw_str_ra.replace(":", " ") 

288 raw_str_dec = raw_str_dec.replace(":", " ") 

289 str_ra = _construct_string(entry=raw_str_ra, exact_length=12, justify="left") 

290 str_dec = _construct_string(entry=raw_str_dec, exact_length=12, justify="left") 

291 # Space which is defined to be blank by the specification. 

292 raw_blank_1 = str(row["blank_1"]) 

293 str_blank_1 = _construct_string( 

294 entry=raw_blank_1, exact_length=9, justify="left" 

295 ) 

296 # The magnitude; this way we can handle both blank strings and numbers. 

297 raw_magnitude = str(row["magnitude"]).strip() 

298 if len(raw_magnitude) == 0 or raw_magnitude.casefold() == "nan": 

299 # There is no magnitude data so just have it blank. 

300 raw_mag_synth = " " 

301 else: 

302 # Magnitude value string must be centered on the decimal point. 

303 raw_mag_whole, raw_mag_frac = raw_magnitude.split(".") 

304 raw_mag_whole = _construct_string( 

305 entry=raw_mag_whole, exact_length=2, justify="right" 

306 ) 

307 raw_mag_frac = _construct_string( 

308 entry=raw_mag_frac, exact_length=2, justify="left" 

309 ) 

310 raw_mag_synth = raw_mag_whole + "." + raw_mag_frac 

311 str_magnitude = _construct_string( 

312 entry=raw_mag_synth, exact_length=5, justify="left" 

313 ) 

314 # The bandpass. 

315 raw_bandpass = str(row["bandpass"]).strip() 

316 str_bandpass = _construct_string( 

317 entry=raw_bandpass, exact_length=1, justify="left" 

318 ) 

319 # The pseudo blank area, which is defined to be blank but is often not 

320 # for some reason. 

321 raw_blank_2 = str(row["blank_2"]) 

322 str_blank_2 = _construct_string( 

323 entry=raw_blank_2, exact_length=6, justify="left" 

324 ) 

325 # The observetory code. 

326 raw_observatory_code = str(row["observatory_code"]) 

327 str_observatory_code = _construct_string( 

328 entry=raw_observatory_code, exact_length=3, justify="left" 

329 ) 

330 # Done. 

331 # From the length controlled strings, the record which encodes the 

332 # information about this row can be derived. 

333 record = ( 

334 str_minor_planet_number 

335 + str_provisional_number 

336 + str_discovery 

337 + str_publishable_note 

338 + str_observing_note 

339 + str_observing_date 

340 + str_ra 

341 + str_dec 

342 + str_blank_1 

343 + str_magnitude 

344 + str_bandpass 

345 + str_blank_2 

346 + str_observatory_code 

347 ) 

348 # Ensure that the record is exactly 80 columns long. 

349 if len(record) != 80: 

350 raise error.DevelopmentError( 

351 "The row derived record string is not 80 columns. The current record" 

352 " string: `{rec}`.".format(rec=record) 

353 ) 

354 else: 

355 # The record is assumed to be good. 

356 return record 

357 # The code should not reach here. 

358 raise error.LogicFlowError 

359 return None 

360 

361 # Creating the records via the table. 

362 records = [] 

363 for rowdex in table: 

364 # The length of the records are checked in the subfunction. 

365 temp_record = _record_to_row_string(row=rowdex) 

366 records.append(temp_record) 

367 # All done. 

368 return records
